intro: Coccoloba excoriata, commonly known as the scarlet bower vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its stems are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid conditions. Coccoloba excoriata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant foliage and attractive floral display.
